channel.title: Brain Teasers
channel.description:
I always loved brain teasers, so I'm going to post two that I know of. Good luck! Also, I may update OP with more brain teasers if anyone has any. The person's name next to the question was the first person to get it right. :)
1). Me and my wife went on a trip this last spring. She drove for the first 40 miles and then I started driving. I drove until we got there. When it was time to go back home, I knew I had to be the man and show her up by driving more than her. Therefore, I drove for 50 miles and let her drive the rest of the way home. How many more miles did I drive than my wife? [b]- eyeownyew[/b]
2). A square has length sides of 4. It's perimeter is 16. It's area is 16. A circle has a radius of 2. It's perimeter is 4π. It's area is 4π. Can you find a triangle that has these same properties?
Solution 1: [b]Jc[/b] - sides of 4sqrt(3) Solution 2: [b]Jc[/b] - s1: 4sqrt(3)+2 s2: 4sqrt(3)+4 s3: 6+sqrt(3) Solution 3: [b]Jc[/b] - s1: 4+2sqrt(2) s2: 4+2sqrt(2) s3: 4+4sqrt(2) Solution 4: [b]Me[/b] ;) - 5, 12, 13
3). There is a mile long tunnel, and this mile long train is coming up to the tunnel. The train is going 60mph how long will it take for the first car to enter, and the last one to leave? [b]- reyx7[/b]
4). There is a speed train leaving Florida going 300mph and one leaving Texas going 250mph, When they pass each other where will they be? [b]- Cole1497[/b]
5). [img]http://img24.imageshack.us/img24/9393/helpxq.jpg[/img] [b]- badger41[/b]
6). Solve this: ALFA + BETA + GAMA = DELTA (Hint: each letter stands for a number. For example A is 1). Solution 1: [b]Jc[/b] - 5305 + 2475 + 6595 = 14375
Solution 2: [b]Jc[/b] - ALFA = 5795 BETA = 6435 GAMA = 2505 DELTA = 14735
7). Five friends have their gardens next to one another, where they grow three kinds of crops: fruits (apple, pear, nut, cherry), vegetables (carrot, parsley, gourd, onion) and flowers (aster, rose, tulip, lily).
1. They grow 12 different varieties. 2. Everybody grows exactly 4 different varieties 3. Each variety is at least in one garden. 4. Only one variety is in 4 gardens. 5. Only in one garden are all 3 kinds of crops. 6. Only in one garden are all 4 varieties of one kind of crops. 7. Pear is only in the two border gardens. 8. Paul's garden is in the middle with no lily. 9. Aster grower doesn't grow vegetables. 10. Rose growers don't grow parsley. 11. Nuts grower has also gourd and parsley. 12. In the first garden are apples and cherries. 13. Only in two gardens are cherries. 14. Sam has onions and cherries. 15. Luke grows exactly two kinds of fruit. 16. Tulip is only in two gardens. 17. Apple is in a single garden. 18. Only in one garden next to Zick's is parsley. 19. Sam's garden is not on the border. 20. Hank grows neither vegetables nor asters. 21. Paul has exactly three kinds of vegetable.
Who has which garden and what is grown where?
Question #8 As many of you might know there are many patterns with Pascal's triangle. [img]http://ptri1.tripod.com/ptreal1r.gif[/img] You find an interesting relationship between the summation of powers and Pascal's triangle. We know the first five sums of k[sup]1[/sup] is 1, 3, 6, 10, 15. Now, if we look at the 3rd diagonal in Pascal's triangle you will find the same exact pattern: 1, 3, 6, 10, 15. Now logically, we would think the fourth diagonal has the same properties. The first five sums of K[sup]2[/sup] is 1, 5, 14, 30, 55. If you add the n term (where n stands for the summation you want to find) plus it's preceding term (we will assume the preceding term in the diagonal for 1 is 0) with the next term it will you give you that summation for K[sup]2[/sup]. (0 + 1 = 1, 1 + 4 = 5, 4 + 10 = 14, 10 + 20 = 30, 20 + 35 = 55, and so on). Now surely there must be a pattern for K[sup]3[/sup]. What is it? How about K[sup]4[/sup]? K[sup]5[/sup]?

item.title: Brain Teasers
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

A G S P U R E:

Think; what other thing could happen to him, no planes, not from space, not anything motorized.

He was in a Hot air balloon and was lacking altitude (With another person). So they striped of their clothes to lose weight, when that didn’t work they drawed straws to decide who should jump.

Read full topic

item.title: Brain Teasers
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:140, topic:423785”]You have a terrible notation. sum k[sup]n[/sup] = k[sup]n + 1[/sup]
I didn’t expect it to be so simple.[/quote]
If that is your solution I don’t think you understood me yet. You have to find a pattern on Pascal’s Triangle that results in the summation of the first n terms for k[sup]3[/sup]. For example in k[sup]2[/sup] you had to add the n term in the diagonal and the n-1 term. This doesn’t work for k[sup]3[/sup].

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr

item.title: Brain Teasers
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:137, topic:423785”][quote author=The Wanderer link=topic=526441.msg4296369#msg4296369 date=1368298252]
Bumping this topic because I added a new brain teaser that I am curious to see if anyone solves. See problem #8.
[/quote]
Your explanation is horrible. Please explain in clearer terms what problem #8 is about.[/quote]

n
sum k = 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 + … + n
k=1

If you sum up to the first term it is 1. If you sum up to the second term it is 3 (1 + 2). If you sum up to the third term it is 6 (1 + 2 + 3). And so on.

n
sum k[sup]2[/sup] = 1[sup]2[/sup] + 2[sup]2[/sup] + 3[sup]2[/sup] + 4[sup]2[/sup] + … + n[sup]2[/sup]
k=1

If you sum up to the first term it is 1, if you sum up to the second term it is 5 (1 + 4), if you sum up to the third term it is 14 (1 + 4 + 9). And so on.


If you look at Pascal’s triangle there is a pattern you can deduce with those same numbers. In k it is simply the numbers in order. For k[sup]2[/sup] you have to add the number and it’s preceding term in the diagonal. Can you find a pattern for k[sup]3[/sup]? How about k[sup]4[/sup]? k[sup]5[/sup]?

Read full topic

#5 isn’t a brain teaser, it’s a rather shitty optical trick

here’s an image to explain

rqAOk.png624×587

as you can see the triangles don’t have straight edges, if you snip the excess off the bottom triangle and make a square with it you get your missing piece

EDIT: I see this was solved before, disregard this

item.title: Brain Teasers
item.dc:creator: @SETO SETO
item.description:
@SETO wrote:

A prime twin is a pair of primes that differ by 2.
Each member of this twin comprises 11,713 decimal digits! How many prime twins are there? Are there infinitely many or finitely many. In the latter case, how many?

2.Paul is 20 years old in 1980, but only 15 years old in 1985. How is this possible?

I turn polar bears white
and I will make you cry.
I make guys have to pee
and girls comb their hair.
I make celebrities look stupid
and normal people look like celebrities.
I turn pancakes brown
and make your champane bubble.
If you sqeeze me, I’ll pop.
If you look at me, you’ll pop.
Can you guess the riddle?

Read full topic

item.title: Brain Teasers
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:118, topic:423785”][quote author=A G S P U R E link=topic=526441.msg3883479#msg3883479 date=1326242636]
Actually 2; 1st one’s the easiest.

There was a 911 call late one Sunday morning, at a millionaires mansion.
The millionaire was found dead in his bedroom after being stabbed repeatedly.
There were only a few people working that day, the cook, the butler, the hedge trimmer, the maid, and the mechanic.
The cook said that he was in the kitchen all night long, the butler said that he was making beds the whole time, the maid said she was getting the mail and cleaning dishes, the hedge trimmer said he was trimming hedges all day long, and the mechanic said that he was working on the new car.
The police officers arrested the murderer immediately, who did it?

2nd one; (harder)

[b][i]Police officers found a body of a man in a field, absolutely nothing was around him, he was completely naked, there were no car tracks, footprints, or anything. Although, they did find his clothes not too far from him, but no tracks were leading to them at all.

How did he die?[/i][/b]
[/quote]
2nd choice: the maid. Mail doesn’t deliver on sunday[/quote]

Good job!

Read full topic
